metadata.title: Modern Literature Database
metadata.description: Contemporary and 20th-21st century literature from diverse voices and perspectives
metadata.focus: Diverse voices, contemporary themes, accessibility-conscious selections

contemporary_fiction.title: Beloved
contemporary_fiction.author: Toni Morrison
contemporary_fiction.summary: Sethe, a former slave, is haunted by the ghost of her deceased daughter in post-Civil War Ohio, exploring the lasting trauma of slavery.
contemporary_fiction.significance: Pulitzer Prize winner, powerful exploration of slavery's psychological impact.
famous_quotes: Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.
She is a friend of my mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order.
contemporary_fiction.accessibility_notes: Complex narrative structure; deals with heavy trauma themes

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Non-linear narrative may be challenging; powerful emotional content
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Rich sensory details; may need content warnings for trauma
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Heavy themes of trauma and violence; healing themes present

contemporary_fiction.title: Things Fall Apart
contemporary_fiction.author: Chinua Achebe
contemporary_fiction.summary: Okonkwo's story in pre-colonial Nigeria and the arrival of European colonizers, exploring the clash between traditional and colonial cultures.
contemporary_fiction.significance: Seminal work of African literature, challenging Western narratives about Africa.
famous_quotes: Until the lions have their own historians, the history of the hunt will always glorify the hunter.
contemporary_fiction.accessibility_notes: Includes Igbo cultural context; glossary helpful

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Clear narrative structure; cultural details maintain interest
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Detailed cultural practices; systematic exploration of social change
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some violence; themes of cultural destruction may be distressing

contemporary_fiction.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
contemporary_fiction.author: Gabriel García Márquez
contemporary_fiction.summary: Multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, blending reality with magical elements.
contemporary_fiction.significance: Masterpiece of magical realism, Nobel Prize winner.
famous_quotes: It is not true that people stop pursuing dreams because they grow old, they grow old because they stop pursuing dreams.
contemporary_fiction.accessibility_notes: Complex family tree; magical realism elements; character guide helpful

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Episodic structure; magical elements maintain interest
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Repetitive patterns and cycles; detailed family relationships
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some dark themes; cyclical nature may be comforting or distressing

diverse_voices.title: The Joy Luck Club
diverse_voices.author: Amy Tan
diverse_voices.summary: Four Chinese-American women and their daughters navigate cultural identity and family relationships across generations.
diverse_voices.significance: Important work exploring Asian-American experience and intergenerational relationships.
diverse_voices.accessibility_notes: Multiple perspectives; cultural context enhances understanding

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Multiple short stories; varied perspectives maintain interest
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Clear family relationships; cultural traditions and customs
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some family conflict; ultimately about connection and understanding

diverse_voices.title: The House on Mango Street
diverse_voices.author: Sandra Cisneros
diverse_voices.summary: Young Esperanza's experiences growing up in a Latino neighborhood in Chicago, told through interconnected vignettes.
diverse_voices.significance: Important Chicana literature, accessible exploration of identity and community.
diverse_voices.accessibility_notes: Short vignettes; accessible language; bilingual elements

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Very short chapters; poetic language; manageable length
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Clear neighborhood setting; systematic exploration of community
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some difficult themes but hopeful tone; short format less overwhelming

diverse_voices.title: The Color Purple
diverse_voices.author: Alice Walker
diverse_voices.summary: Celie's journey from abuse to empowerment in the rural South, told through letters to God and her sister.
diverse_voices.significance: Pulitzer Prize winner, powerful story of resilience and sisterhood.
famous_quotes: I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it.
diverse_voices.accessibility_notes: Dialect and letter format; heavy themes require content warnings

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Letter format creates natural breaks; emotional intensity
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Clear character development; may need content warnings
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Heavy abuse themes; ultimately empowering and healing

neurodivergent_authors.title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
neurodivergent_authors.author: Mark Haddon
neurodivergent_authors.summary: Christopher, a teenager with autism, investigates the death of a neighbor's dog, uncovering family secrets.
neurodivergent_authors.significance: Popular novel featuring autistic protagonist, though author's representation is debated.
neurodivergent_authors.accessibility_notes: First-person autistic perspective; mathematical and logical elements

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Mystery format maintains interest; clear logical progression
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some family conflict; generally empowering for neurodivergent readers

neurodivergent_authors.title: Flowers for Algernon
neurodivergent_authors.author: Daniel Keyes
neurodivergent_authors.summary: Charlie Gordon undergoes experimental surgery to increase his intelligence, exploring what it means to be human.
neurodivergent_authors.significance: Hugo and Nebula Award winner, profound exploration of intelligence and humanity.
neurodivergent_authors.accessibility_notes: Changing writing style reflects character's development; emotional intensity

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Compelling premise; emotional engagement maintains interest
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Systematic exploration of intelligence and social relationships
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Tragic elements; themes of acceptance and dignity

contemporary_global.title: Persepolis
contemporary_global.author: Marjane Satrapi
contemporary_global.summary: Graphic memoir of growing up during the Islamic Revolution in Iran and subsequent exile.
contemporary_global.significance: Important graphic memoir combining personal and political history.
contemporary_global.accessibility_notes: Graphic novel format; visual storytelling aids comprehension

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Visual format; episodic structure; engaging historical content
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Clear visual narrative; historical context and political systems
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some political violence; ultimately about resilience and identity

contemporary_global.title: The Kite Runner
contemporary_global.author: Khaled Hosseini
contemporary_global.summary: Amir's journey to redeem himself for betraying his childhood friend Hassan, set against Afghanistan's tumultuous history.
contemporary_global.significance: Popular novel bringing Afghan culture and history to Western readers.
contemporary_global.accessibility_notes: Some Dari/Pashto terms; historical context helpful

neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Clear moral themes; detailed cultural context
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Heavy themes of guilt and violence; redemptive arc

science_fiction_fantasy.title: The Left Hand of Darkness
science_fiction_fantasy.author: Ursula K. Le Guin
science_fiction_fantasy.summary: Envoy Genly Ai visits a planet where inhabitants can change gender, exploring themes of gender, politics, and communication.
science_fiction_fantasy.significance: Groundbreaking exploration of gender and society in science fiction.
science_fiction_fantasy.accessibility_notes: Complex world-building; gender concepts may require adjustment

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Unique premise maintains interest; political intrigue
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Some political tension; ultimately about understanding and communication

science_fiction_fantasy.title: Parable of the Sower
science_fiction_fantasy.author: Octavia Butler
science_fiction_fantasy.summary: Lauren Olamina develops a new religion while surviving in a climate-changed, dystopian America.
science_fiction_fantasy.significance: Prescient dystopian novel by groundbreaking African-American science fiction author.
science_fiction_fantasy.accessibility_notes: Intense dystopian themes; strong female protagonist

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Survival narrative maintains tension; compelling world-building
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Systematic development of new religion/philosophy; clear leadership themes
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Dark dystopian themes; ultimately about hope and community building

young_adult_crossover.title: The Hate U Give
young_adult_crossover.author: Angie Thomas
young_adult_crossover.summary: Starr Carter witnesses the police shooting of her childhood friend and finds her voice as an activist.
young_adult_crossover.significance: Important contemporary novel addressing police brutality and racial justice.

neurodivergent_friendly.adhd: Contemporary setting; engaging social justice themes
neurodivergent_friendly.autism: Clear moral issues; systematic exploration of identity and activism
neurodivergent_friendly.anxiety: Heavy themes of violence and injustice; empowering activism message
